alert.note: Alert for Coastal Rockingham (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 23 at 2:35PM EST until January 23 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW WILL COME TO AN END THIS EVENING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations up to two inches for a storm total of 3 to 5 inches. * WHERE...Coastal Rockingham County. * WHEN...Until 10 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Although snowfall totals will be light, travel will still be impacted due to snowfall accumulations on untreated roads. The potential exists for snowbands that will bring periods of locally heavy snowfall, which will lead to rapid snow accumulations and extremely dangerous travel conditions. Even light snowfall amounts can accumulate on roads and cause dangerous driving conditions due to snow covered roads. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
